necessity.statement: In a deterministic memoryless system f: V -> V, Control = 0
necessity.proof: H = {*} singleton implies no h1 != h2 exists, existential quantifier fails

sufficiency.statement: Hidden state H enables Control iff (C1) H causally influences V, (C2) H is overwriteable, (C3) Multiple H values reachable
sufficiency.proof: C1 is definition of Control; C2, C3 ensure dynamic achievability

counterexamples_tested.spatial_structure_as_hidden_state: REFUTED - spatial context is part of V
counterexamples_tested.nonlocal_coupling_as_hidden_state: REFUTED - still deterministic f: V -> V
counterexamples_tested.rule_asymmetry_as_hidden_state: REFUTED - asymmetry is in f, not in H

theoretical_chain: Hidden state VARIES across space and time
Same visible pattern + different hidden state = different OUTCOME
This context-dependence IS Control by definition
Control concentrates at BOUNDARIES (where hidden state varies most)
